headline: weather advisory in effect
description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm.
Risk of freezing rain leading to icy and slippery conditions.

When:
Continuing through Thursday morning.

Additional information:
Snow may become mixed with ice pellets and freezing rain today. For the city of Sault Ste. Marie, snow is expected to change over to rain this morning. For St. Joseph Island, precipitation is expected to be mainly rain. Please refer to the rainfall warning that is in effect for more details.

Areas north of Sault Ste. Marie may receive snowfall amounts up to 10 cm. Confidence in snowfall amounts remains low as temperatures will be close to the freezing mark.

All areas will switch over to snow tonight as much colder air moves into the region. Ice pellets and freezing rain may occur during the transition.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. Slow down driving in slippery conditions. Watch for taillights ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
